data.title: 2022 Festival Tickets & Schedule
data.meta_description: The second annual Bridgeport Film Fest   plans to offer both  in-person and virtual screenings , as well  guest speakers  from the entertainment  industry and  creative workshops  for both...
data.text:
4:00pm-5:30pm

VIP + Filmmaker Red Carpet

Featuring DJ Edgewood spinning LIVE!

5:00pm-6:00pm

General Admission Red Carpet

6:00pm-6:10pm

BFF Welcome Address

6:10pm-7:50pm

Block 1Hometown Glory: CT Stories with Filmmaker Q&A

A film block celebrating the diversity of storytellers from Bridgeport and across the Nutmeg State!

8:15pm-9:30pm

Block 2To Be Queer+ Prideful Stories with Filmmaker Q&A

Kicking off Greater Bridgeport Pride with a film block highlighting LGBTQIA+ stories and filmmakers!

9:30pm-10pm

A Prideful Panel

LGBTQIA Filmmakers in discussion with moderator David A. Correa, Director of Entertainment NYC Pride!

​

10:30pm -1:00am

VIP After Party* ​ [at the Nest Arts Factory]

Featuring Jukebox Radio performing live!

*Must have a VIP Pass or purchase an additional ticket to this event.

11:00am-12:30pm

Screenwriting Fundamentals Masterclasswith Brian Hogan, Filmmaker and Sacred Heart University Professor

Sign up here!

12pm-6pm

Food Trucks /Vendors

1:00pm-2:00pm

The "How Did I get Here" Actors Panel

Featuring Comedic Icon Lisa Lampanelli, 'Batgirl' star Ivory Aquino and Award Winning Actor/Writer Aizzah Fatima.

2:15pm-3:30pm

Creating A Character" Acting Workshop

Led by Joel Oramas, Professor and AEA Actor

Sign up here!

2:30pm-4:15pm

Block 3 A Women’s World with Filmmaker Q&A

The future is female and what better way to celebrate female identifying filmmakers by having an entire block dedicated to their diverse stories.

​

4:45pm-6:30pm

Block 4 Mixtape Madness with Filmmaker Q&A

Throwback to classic 90s mixtapes but this time we will feature a 90 minute block of genre bending films featuring comedy, drama, romance, experimental, documentaries and more!

7:00pm-9:45pm

“The Greatest Radio Station in the World” WPKN FILM

​Public World Premiere!

Doors open at 7:00 | Film starts at 7:15pm

Followed by Q+A with Director Cob Carlson, moderated by Dr. Shannon Pittman-Fairley

WPKN began as the University of Bridgeport’s college radio station in 1963. It has been operating as a listener-supported, community-based radio station since 1989. There are only three paid staffers…the General Manager and the Operations Manager are full-time, and the Office Manager is part-time. All of the Programmers are volunteers.

The film by Cob Carlson, will be carried by this cast of characters, as well as the listeners, station volunteers, and DJs from the past. We will hear interviewees share their personal, idiosyncratic stories, speaking passionately about their love of music, news, politics, health, cars, organic gardening, space exploration, and culture.

Like the radio station, this film will be fearless, boldly independent, free form, and unconventional. WPKN prides itself on being a real alternative to an increasingly homogeneous broadcast radio landscape. It enriches the lives of their listeners while promoting diversity, tolerance, and freedom of expression. It is a story worth documenting!

10:00pm-1:00am

​VIP After Party* [at Wali Kafe]

Featuring DJ Eric Otero spinning live!

​*Must have a VIP Pass or purchase an additional ticket to this event. ​
